conclusion: The task is to predict which container (E, F, or G) the liquid will flow into after passing through baffles.
The liquid starts at points labeled A, B, C, and D at the top of the image.
There are baffles positioned in the middle of the path, labeled A, B, C, and D, which are slanted in different directions.
At the bottom of the image, there are three containers labeled E, F, and G, each with a corresponding baffle leading into it.
The liquid flows through baffles A, B, C, and D in a specific direction based on their slant.
The liquid will continue in the same direction after passing through baffles E, F, and G.
The final position of the liquid will be at point G based on the flow direction.
The liquid will flow into container G after passing through baffles E, F, and G.
